intro: Notocactus rudibuenekeri subsp. glomeratus, commonly known as the clustered notocactus, is a cactus species native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is characterized by its cylindrical stems that often branch into clusters, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces yellow to orange flowers during the summer months, which are typically borne in clusters at the stem tips. It is adapted to high-altitude environments and requires well-drained soil and full sunlight. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
